connector.description: Manage keys stored in AWS KMS instances.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient
camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient.description: To use a existing configured AWS KMS as client

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to perform One of: [listKeys] [createKey] [disableKey] [scheduleKeyDeletion] [describeKey] [enableKey]

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the KMS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the KMS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the KMS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which KMS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.component.aws-kms.autoDiscoverClie.name: camel.component.aws-kms.autoDiscoverClient
camel.component.aws-kms.autoDiscoverClie.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.component.aws-kms.kmsClient.name: camel.component.aws-kms.kmsClient
camel.component.aws-kms.kmsClient.description: To use a existing configured AWS KMS as client

camel.component.aws-kms.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.aws-kms.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws-kms.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws-kms.operation.name: camel.component.aws-kms.operation
camel.component.aws-kms.operation.description: The operation to perform One of: [listKeys] [createKey] [disableKey] [scheduleKeyDeletion] [describeKey] [enableKey]

camel.component.aws-kms.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws-kms.proxyHost
camel.component.aws-kms.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the KMS client

camel.component.aws-kms.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws-kms.proxyPort
camel.component.aws-kms.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the KMS client

camel.component.aws-kms.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws-kms.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws-kms.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the KMS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws-kms.region.name: camel.component.aws-kms.region
camel.component.aws-kms.region.description: The region in which KMS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.component.aws-kms.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.aws-kms.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws-kms.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
